content: As I was riding my motorcycle over to Portsmouth, NH yesterday, I was on I-95 approaching the edge of what use to be Pease AFB. I looked up and watched what looked like an A-300 or something like that, all white, no markings that I recall, as it passed only a few hundred feet over my head. My understanding is that these are the jets that bring the Troops back from Iraq or Afghanistan. I thought about turning into the airport and joining in on the "Welcome Home" gathering that I hoped they would be greeted with. Then I thought maybe it wasn't really my place to be there, save it for the family and friends. Thinking back, I kind of wish I did go. I'd probably freak some people out as I'd want to give as many of them a hug...."Who the heck was that guy?" Maybe I'll have to start going to those. Any thoughts? Don Proud father of a U.S. Marine
reply: As I was riding my motorcycle over to Portsmouth, NH yesterday, I was on I-95 approaching the edge of what use to be Pease AFB. content: Don – next time GO!! The worst that would happen is you’d be turned away or it wasn’t returning troops. Besides the PGR I also belong to “Warriors Watch” They focus on WELCOM HOMEs as there is more of those than funerals!! http://www.warriorswatch.org/ choose joy each day

content: quote: Originally posted by MissU2: DO IT DON!!! That would be cool. The last WELCOME HOME I went to the young Marine (after hugging his ma) said he really wanted pizza! Years ago, I read the book, "In the Company of Heroes" by CWO Michael Durant. He was the pilot of Black Hawk "Super 64" that was shot down over Somalia and help captive for 12 days. In his book, he said while he was being held, he often though of eating Papa Gino's pizza again. Papa Gino's is a pizza chain that I think is only in New England. It's my favorite! FYI, Durant is from NH. Don
quote: Originally posted by MissU2: DO IT DON!!! That would be cool. The last WELCOME HOME I went to the young Marine (after hugging his ma) said he really wanted pizza!

content: Sorry about the size of the above picture, but it is an American pilot standing next to his plane that was hit while flying over Dien Bien Phu... The markings on the planes may have been French, but the planes and pilots were actually American. "Earthquake" McGoon, who was shot down and killed in 1954, was America's first casualty in that war... Air America has been flying in some form or another ever since - Shadow Force - - Wandering and Wondering
reply: Sorry about the size of the above picture, but it is an American pilot standing next to his plane that was hit while flying over Dien Bien Phu... The markings on the planes may have been French, but the planes and pilots were actually American. content: quote: Some say that's the kind of aircraft they fly into and out of Area 51. Groom Lake flights are all white, with a narrow red strip down the side. NO markings, though........ BUT, you can't see those planes, either..... they don't exist!

reply: Groom Lake flights are all white, with a narrow red strip down the side. NO markings, though........ BUT, you can't see those planes, either..... they don't exist!
title: The White Jets.....returning troops

content: I flew out of Langley for DS/DS on a 747 white flight. It was owned by TWA at one time. The crew were all volunteers and when we got to the Mid East we were shadowed by F-16s. Any and all other deployments I was on were commerical or C-141.
reply: I flew out of Langley for DS/DS on a 747 white flight. It was owned by TWA at one time. The crew were all volunteers and when we got to the Mid East we were shadowed by F-16s. Any and all other deployments I was on were commerical or C-141.

content: Don, this is off the subject, but about Portsmouth. I used to live on Pease AFB, same year Kennedy was assassinated. I remember my address, 53 Woodbine Terr. Do you know if all the base housing is gone now? Ok, back to the thread.....
reply: Don, this is off the subject, but about Portsmouth. I used to live on Pease AFB, same year Kennedy was assassinated. I remember my address, 53 Woodbine Terr. Do you know if all the base housing is gone now? Ok, back to the thread.....
title: The White Jets.....returning troops

content: quote: Originally posted by RetiredMarineWife: Don, this is off the subject, but about Portsmouth. I used to live on Pease AFB, same year Kennedy was assassinated. I remember my address, 53 Woodbine Terr. Do you know if all the base housing is gone now? Ok, back to the thread..... Sorry for the delay in answering, I just saw this. Base housing is gone as far as I know. Everything that use to be base housing is now filled with private companies. One for example is the HeathSouth rehab place I use to go to. There's also a major Brewery/restaurant there...I know, I know, why wasn't it there when you guys lived there, right? I think it was the old E Club, unless it was the O club, it's now Paddy's Restaurant, great food with hot babes working there. It seems so weird even to this day for me to be able to ride around freely there. I remember when it was a SAC base with guards everywhere. Don
quote: Originally posted by RetiredMarineWife: Don, this is off the subject, but about Portsmouth. I used to live on Pease AFB, same year Kennedy was assassinated. I remember my address, 53 Woodbine Terr. Do you know if all the base housing is gone now? Ok, back to the thread.....
